Social Media Intern
Remote, United States

As our Social Media Intern, you will leverage our social media platforms to build brand awareness and drive engagement amongst our audiences. title: Marketing & Social Media Intern
requirements:
Part-time Internship (8-12 hours/week)

Are you social media savvy with a knack for marketing? We are looking for a marketing and social media intern to work with us to increase brand awareness and customer engagement. Candidate must be able to take initiative and work independently and alongside management on multiple marketing initiatives.

Please note this internship is unpaid but may be eligible for college credit depending on your program. For the exceptionally motivated candidate, this internship can lead to a part-time paid position as we continue to grow. Hours and start and end dates are flexible.

Required qualifications:
• Proficiency and understanding of social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter)
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Familiarity with the Hometown brand and values
• A thirst for knowledge and problem solving
• Experience with Photoshop and graphic design tools is a plus!

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Drafting monthly newsletters and updating the mailing list
• Taking photographs (food, storefront, lifestyle, etc.)
• Posting to social media and engaging with customers
• Design custom marketing materials for print and online
• Identifying partnership opportunities and building relationships
• Acting as a communication liaison to keep local publications informed of upcoming events

Benefits to working at Hometown Café and Poké Bar include:
• Starting wages above state minimum
• A meal on us during your shift
• Periodic team events (dinners, activities, and more)
• Continuous on-the-job training and development
• Exposure to business building and working in the start-up environment

As a member of the Hometown team, you will bring a positive attitude and be willing to help with any task, no matter how big or small. We are a tight-knit family that is passionate about the Hometown values, serving quality food, and providing great customer service. We hope you’ll fit right into our weird, but loving family and embody our same values

title: Social Media Internship
requirements:
About: Maternova is a pioneering global health venture focused on saving maternal and newborn lives around the world through its pioneering e-commerce platform for health technologies. This award-winning venture seeks to continue to add products and reach new markets and customers and to build its brand using social media.

Internship Description:

The social media intern will be involved in multi-channel social media messaging and connecting with other ventures, countries, and initiatives in women’s health, newborn health, medical devices and diagnostics, and global health. The job will entail increasing posting quality, frequency, and strategic placement on the right platform at the right time. The intern will work with the CEO and Chief Strategy Officer to continue to build a social media strategy that is powered by the mission of the company—to get low-cost, high-quality medical innovations into the hands of those providing clinical care around the world. Twitter is the primary channel, but increasing our LinkedIn ‘voice’ and traffic, as well as Instagram, will be the focus for the semester.

If the candidate speaks another language fluently (esp French or Spanish or Portuguese) this is an added attribute for the position. This is an ideal position for a college senior or graduate student who is taking time off due to Covid and has time to invest in a fast-paced social enterprise with a global brand.

Qualifications and Requirements:
• The candidate must be well versed in Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook, LinkedIn and be able to expertly manage across platforms using a social media manager like Hootsuite
• Concrete prior experience in social media messaging (hashtag research, metrics for social media)
• The candidate must have impeccable spelling and grammar and a keen eye for design and composition for the visual aspects of social media (creating compelling images on Canva)
• The candidate will ideally have strong public health and global health knowledge, preferably with a focus on maternal and child health
• Junior/Seniors/Graduate Students only; GPA 3.5 or above only
• Strong work ethic and time management are essential

Job Information

Pearson Media/Public Relations Intern in Providence, Rhode Island

Media/Public Relations Intern - ( 2103471 )

Description

The GED test has opened doors to better jobs and college programs for more than 20 million graduates since 1942. The GED test is accepted by virtually all U.S. colleges and employers. As the creator of the official GED test, GED Testing Service has a responsibility to ensure that the program continues to be a reliable and valuable pathway to a better life for the millions of adults without a high school diploma. GED Testing Service is a joint venture between the American Council on Education and Pearson. For more information, go to ged.com.

GED Testing Service is seeking a digital media savvy intern to maintain and expand our PR/Communications and communications with key stakeholders. Our new team member will help craft and implement our communications plans and digital marketing campaigns. You can expect to help draft press releases, media statements, newsletters, social media content, as well as work on tracking and measuring social and traditional media coverage of the GED brand.

We are seeking someone who is a strong writer, detail-oriented, and knowledgeable about media trends. You should be a self-starter, creative thinker, collaborative contributor, and have a positive attitude.

The person in this role will work very closely with the Communications/PR and Marketing teams, interact with the organization's executive leaders, and report to the communications director. Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Qualifications
• Currently a junior or senior in college, in pursuit of a bachelors degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing or related field
• Strong writing and verbal communication skills and well versed in grammar. Must be able to write in both professional and conversational/personable tones.
• Understand and be comfortable using the large social media platforms Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube
• Interested and familiar with education, public relations/communications, and social media
• Team player who works well with others and isnt afraid to ask questions
• Detail-oriented, cares about how our communications will impact thousands of people
• Develop new content, including blog posts, emails, newsletter ideas
• Support communications director with daily operations including drafting press releases and statements, media outreach, pitching journalists, and creating educator-facing content
• Work closely with State Relationship Managers and other teams to create one-pagers and fact sheets to support state level and national work
• Build and update media lists and databases; monitor daily news and mentions; create internal newsletters through media monitoring software
• Plan, schedule, and upload content on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn
• Assist marketing team with monitoring all social media channels to engage with users through Hootsuite
• Assist with tracking analytics and developing reports related to media mentions, newsletter readership, and website traffic
